Lagi Heboh Fenomena Desa 'Hantu', Bagaimana Aturan Bikin Desa Beneran?
05 Nov 2019, 10:15 by Hendra Kusuma


Ilustrasi Desa 'Hantu' (Foto: Erliana Riady/detikcom)

Jakarta - Kementerian Keuangan mendapat laporan bahwa ada desa fiktif alias 'hantu' yang sengaja dibentuk untuk mendapatkan aliran uang dari program dana desa. Anggaran dana desa sebesar Rp 70 triliun di tahun 2019. Indonesia memiliki 74.597 desa, di mana setiap desa mendapatkan anggaran sekitar Rp 900 juta.Dirjen Bina Pemerintahan Desa Kementerian Dalam Negeri (Kemendagri), Nata Irawan mengatakan pembentukan desa diatur dalam Permendagri Nomor 1 Tahun 2017 tentang Penataan Desa.Dalam aturan itu, Nata mengungkapkan ada tiga syarat utama yang harus dipenuhi oleh Pemerintah Daerah (Pemda) dalam membentuk sebuah desa baru di wilayahnya."Syaratnya ada di atur di dalam Permendagri, itu diatur pembentukan desa," kata Nata saat dihubungi detikcom, Jakarta, Selasa (5/11/2019).Dalam beleid itu, Nata mengungkapkan syarat utama adalah mengenai jumlah penduduk, luas wilayah, dan peta batas desa itu sendiri. Jika tidak memenuhi tiga syarat itu, maka pembentukan atau pemekaran desa di daerah tidak akan bisa."Itu syarat mutlak. Kalau yang 3 itu nggak ada nggak bakal kejadian," jelas dia.Berdasarkan Permendagri Nomor 1 tentang Penataan Desa, pembentukan desa diatur pada Bab V. Di mana mempertimbangkan prakarsa masyarakat desa, asal usul, adat istiadat, kondisi sosial budaya masyarakat desa, serta kemampuan dan potensi desa itu sendiri.Mengenai jumlah penduduk dalam pembentukan desa tiap wilayah berbeda-beda. Seperti Jawa harus memiliki paling sedikit 6.000 jiwa atau 1.200 kepala keluarga. Wilayah Bali harus memiliki paling sedikit 5.000 jiwa atau 1.000 kepala keluarga. Wilayah Sumatera paling sedikit 4.000 jiwa atau 800 kepala keluarga.Wilayah Sulawesi Selatan dan Utara paling sedikit 3.000 jiwa atau 600 kepala keluarga. Wilayah NTB paling sedikit 2.500 jiwa atau 500 kepala keluarga. Wilayah Sulaweai Tengah, Barat, Tenggara, Gorontalo, dan Kalimantan Selatan paling sedikit 2.000 jiwa atau 400 kepala keluarga.Selanjutnya, wilayah Kalimatan Timur, Barat, Tengah, dan Utara paling sedikit 1.500 jiwa atau 350 kepala keluarga. Wilayah NTT, Maluku, dan Maluku Utara paling sedikit 1.000 jiwa atau 300 kepala keluarga. Wilayah Papua dan Papua Barat paling sedikit 500 jiwa atau 100 kepala keluarga.Ada juga syarat seperti batas usia induk desa paling sedikit 5 tahun terhitung sejak pembentukan. Lalu, wilayah kerja memiliki akses transportasi antar wilayah, hingga memiliki potensi yang meliputi SDA, SDM, dan sumber saya ekonomi yang pendukung. More Splashy Phenomenon of 'Ghost' Villages, How Do Rules Make a Real Village?
05 Nov 2019, 10:15 by Hendra Kusuma


Illustration of 'Ghost' Village (Photo: Erliana Riady / detikcom)

Jakarta - The Ministry of Finance received a report that there was a fictitious village alias 'ghost' that was intentionally formed to get the flow of money from the village fund program. Village fund budget of Rp 70 trillion in 2019. Indonesia has 74,597 villages, where each village gets a budget of around Rp 900 million. Director General of Village Ministry of Home Affairs (Ministry of Home Affairs), Nata Irawan said the formation of villages is regulated in Permendagri No. 1 of 2017 Regarding Village Arrangement. In the regulation, Nata revealed that there are three main requirements that must be fulfilled by the Regional Government (Pemda) in forming a new village in its territory. detikcom, Jakarta, Tuesday (11/5/2019). In that regulation, Nata revealed the main requirements were regarding population, area and map of the village boundary itself. If it does not meet the three conditions, then the formation or division of villages in the region will not be able to "That is an absolute condition. If the 3rd one does not occur, it will not happen," he explained. V. Where to consider the initiatives of the village community, origins, customs, social and cultural conditions of the village community, as well as the ability and potential of the village itself. Regarding the population in the formation of villages in each region varies. Like Java, it must have at least 6,000 people or 1,200 families. Bali region must have at least 5,000 inhabitants or 1,000 families. Sumatra region has at least 4,000 people or 800 families. South and North Sulawesi regions have at least 3,000 people or 600 families. The NTB region has at least 2,500 people or 500 households. Sulaweai Central, West, Southeast, Gorontalo, and South Kalimantan regions have at least 2,000 inhabitants or 400 families. Furthermore, East, West, Central and North Kalimantan areas have at least 1,500 people or 350 families. NTT, Maluku and North Maluku regions have at least 1,000 people or 300 households. Papua and West Papua regions have at least 500 inhabitants or 100 families. There are also requirements such as the age limit of the parent village for at least 5 years from the time of formation. Then, the work area has access to transportation between regions, so it has the potential to include natural resources, human resources, and my supporting economic resources.
